001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util;
007
008import java.util.Objects;
009import java.util.stream.Stream;
010
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
013import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.SuppressFBWarnings;
014
015public final class ObjectUtils {
016  private ObjectUtils() {
017    // disable construction
018  }
019
020  /**
021   * Assert that the provided object is not {@code null}.
022   * <p>
023   * This method sets the expectation that the provided object is not {@code null}
024   * in cases where a non-null value is required.
025   *
026   * @param <T>
027   *          the object type
028   * @param obj
029   *          the object
030   * @return the object
031   */
032  @NonNull
033  public static <T> T notNull(@Nullable T obj) {
034    assert obj != null;
035    return obj;
036  }
037
038  /**
039   * Require a non-null value.
040   *
041   * @param <T>
042   *          the type of the reference
043   * @param obj
044   *          the object reference to check for nullity
045   * @return {@code obj} if not {@code null}
046   * @throws NullPointerException
047   *           if {@code obj} is {@code null}
048   */
049  @NonNull
050  @SuppressFBWarnings("NP_PARAMETER_MUST_BE_NONNULL_BUT_MARKED_AS_NULLABLE")
051  public static <T> T requireNonNull(@Nullable T obj) {
052    if (obj == null) {
053      throw new NullPointerException(); // NOPMD
054    }
055    return obj;
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Require a non-null value.
060   *
061   * @param <T>
062   *          the type of the reference
063   * @param obj
064   *          the object reference to check for nullity
065   * @param message
066   *          detail message to be used in the event that a {@code
067   *                NullPointerException} is thrown
068   * @return {@code obj} if not {@code null}
069   * @throws NullPointerException
070   *           if {@code obj} is {@code null}
071   */
072  @NonNull
073  @SuppressFBWarnings("NP_PARAMETER_MUST_BE_NONNULL_BUT_MARKED_AS_NULLABLE")
074  public static <T> T requireNonNull(@Nullable T obj, @NonNull String message) {
075    if (obj == null) {
076      throw new NullPointerException(message); // NOPMD
077    }
078    return obj;
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * A filter used to remove null items from a stream.
083   *
084   * @param <T>
085   *          the item type
086   * @param item
087   *          the item to filter
088   * @return the item as a steam or an empty stream if the item is {@code null}
089   */
090  @SuppressWarnings("null")
091  @NonNull
092  public static <T> Stream<T> filterNull(T item) {
093    return Objects.nonNull(item) ? Stream.of(item) : Stream.empty();
094  }
095
096  /**
097   * Cast the provided object as the requested return type.
098   *
099   * @param <T>
100   *          the Java type to cast the object to
101   * @param obj
102   *          the object to cast
103   * @return the object cast to the requested type
104   * @throws ClassCastException
105   *           if the object cannot be cast to the requested type
106   */
107  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
108  @NonNull
109  public static <T> T asType(@NonNull Object obj) {
110    return (T) obj;
111  }
112
113  /**
114   * Cast the provided object as the requested return type.
115   * <p>
116   * If the object is {@code null}, the returned value will be {@code null}.
117   *
118   * @param <T>
119   *          the Java type to cast the object to
120   * @param obj
121   *          the object to cast, which may be {@code null}
122   * @return the object cast to the requested type, or {@code null} if the
123   *         provided object is {@code null}
124   * @throws ClassCastException
125   *           if the object cannot be cast to the requested type
126   */
127  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
128  @Nullable
129  public static <T> T asNullableType(@Nullable Object obj) {
130    return (T) obj;
131  }
132}
